title: How did you promote your book? - Quora

response.answer_text: As my book is not in a very popular topic, like teenage vampire novels, for example (it’s about the disintegration of Yugoslavia and my participation in the resulting wars), I concentrated my promotion efforts on the small group of people who might be interested in those events. I think that it’s most important that you target a specific audience. If your promotion efforts are too widespread, you won’t sell many books. For each “target”, I had a slightly different approach: People in Kosovo Although my book was published in an Albanian language edition[1] more than six months ago, I still haven’t done an official book launch. I’m not convinced that it will generate a lot of attention. Thankfully, I know a lot of journalists and therefore, most of my promotion is via internet news sites. People abroad I did a book reading in Switzerland and I will have another one soon in Croatia. This is a very good way to promote your book. People buy your book in advance and take it to the book reading for you to sign it. Soldiers I gave away free copies for all the soldiers in my unit in Kosovo. My buddies in Germany[2] and Croatia, however, had to buy it online. I also gave some books in English[3] to a couple of US Army Special Forces that I met a short while ago.  During a book reading event Soldiers have their own information channels. When they like a book, they recommend it to their buddies and sometimes, this interest in a book spreads over from the military to other people. People are curious and ask:” Why do soldiers like this book so much?” and buy it. I also produced a number of promo videos for my book. People prefer watching a video to reading text. With promo videos, you reach a lot of people, but on the other hand, these folks aren’t necessarily the most avid book lovers. For my book, the best and most successful promotion was done by targeting a rather small audience. Better to have fifty people that buy your book, like it, and then promote it to others than wasting your money on expensive ads. One of the best ways to promote your book will be to get Bloggers & Influencers to review your Book. This can be one of the simplest way to promote you book. But how can you do this? Here comes your answer!! STEPS TO DO IT: CREATE A SPREADSHEETYou can make entire plan in one excel sheet. Make a list for the bloggers that you are planning to contact. It must have all the details that you would like to consider. The most important ones being The nameContact detailsLink to their blogLinks to their social media sitesNames of books they have reviewed beforeMoz RankSIMILAR BOOKSBrowse the internet thoroughly to find similar books and check who reviewed them. Goodreads is the best place to Consider CHECK THEIR POLICYSome bloggers have strict policies when it comes to reviews. Before reaching out, check out their review policy and get an idea of what they want. REACH:The make or break for any deal is the reach. The most important parameter for blogging, bloggers reach can be ascertained by some of the following methods: Moz rank to check their trafficCheck out the number of followers they have on Social MediaThe engagement of the posts garner.ENGAGE WITH THE BLOGGERSMake some time to engage with bloggers. Try to involve with their blog, leave comments, respond to questions and keep the engagement going. Book bloggers are not just reviewers, but key stakeholders who bring in a lot of buzz around your book.
